metadata.title: CVE-2016-1616 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The CustomButton::AcceleratorPressed function inui/views/controls/button/custom_button.cc in Google Chrome before48.0.2564.82 allows remote attackers to spoof URLs via vectors involving anunfocused custom button.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1108').
